article_title: Stars formed 100 million years later than thought
article_text:
A photograph of galaxy NGC 6744, considered by scientists to greatly resemble the Milky Way (EOS)

Polarized light from the earliest days of the universe has revealed that the first stars were formed far later than previously believed, the European Space Agency announced on Thursday. That revelation comes after the ESA released new high-resolution maps of the sky captured by the Planck satellite between…

A photograph of galaxy NGC 6744, considered by scientists to greatly resemble the Milky Way (EOS)Polarized light from the earliest days of the universe has revealed that the first stars were formed far later than previously believed, the European Space Agency announced on Thursday.
